# The `X86IndirectThunks.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> that injects an MI thunk that is used to lower indirect calls in a way that prevents speculation on some x86 processors and can be used to mitigate security vulnerabilities due to targeted speculative execution and side channels such as CVE-2017-5715. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> that injects an MI thunk that is used to lower indirect calls in a way that prevents speculation on some x86 processors and can be used to mitigate security vulnerabilities due to targeted speculative execution and side channels such as CVE-2017-5715.

Currently supported thunks include:
<ul>
<li>Retpoline – A RET-implemented trampoline that lowers indirect calls</li>
<li>LVI Thunk – A CALL/JMP-implemented thunk that forces load serialization before making an indirect call/jump</li>
</ul>


Note that the reason that this is implemented as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunctionpass">MachineFunctionPass</a> and not a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulepass">ModulePass</a> is that ModulePasses at this point in the LLVM <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> pipeline serialize all transformations, which can consume lots of memory.

TODO(chandlerc): All of this code could use better comments and documentation.

<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// direct call/jump to a thunk that looks like:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lfence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// jmpq &#42;%r11</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;&#96;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This ensures that if the value in register %r11 was loaded from memory,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then the value in %r11 is (architecturally) correct prior to the jump.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3d142c9e7c066059e15232c56dec9e2e">getName</a>() == </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;r11&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;r11:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   callq .Lr11&#95;call&#95;target</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// .Lr11&#95;capture&#95;spec:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   pause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   lfence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   jmp .Lr11&#95;capture&#95;spec</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// .align 16</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// .Lr11&#95;call&#95;target:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   movq %r11, (%rsp)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   retq</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ThunkReg = X86::R11;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For 32-bit targets we need to emit a collection of thunks for various</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible scratch registers as well as a fallback that uses EDI, which is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// normally callee saved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;eax:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         calll .Leax&#95;call&#95;target</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   .Leax&#95;capture&#95;spec:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         pause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         jmp .Leax&#95;capture&#95;spec</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   .align 16</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   .Leax&#95;call&#95;target:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         movl %eax, (%esp)  # Clobber return addr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         retl</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;ecx:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ... # Same setup</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         movl %ecx, (%esp)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         retl</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;edx:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ... # Same setup</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         retl</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;edi:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3d142c9e7c066059e15232c56dec9e2e">getName</a>() == <a href="#a6df2f9102a92dfd1ac8a5fc8f02bd09d">EAXRetpolineName</a>)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The MIR verifier thinks that the CALL in the entry block will fall through</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to CaptureSpec, so mark it as the successor. Technically, CaptureTarget is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the successor, but the MIR verifier doesn&#39;t know how to cope with that.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Entry-&gt;addSuccessor(CaptureSpec);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the capture loop for speculation, we want to stop the processor from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// speculating as fast as possible. On Intel processors, the PAUSE instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will block speculation without consuming any execution resources. On AMD</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// processors, the PAUSE instruction is (essentially) a nop, so we also use an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LFENCE instruction which they have advised will stop speculation as well</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with minimal resource utilization. We still end the capture with a jump to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// form an infinite loop to fully guarantee that no matter what implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the x86 ISA, speculating this code path never escapes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a17e04afcf0c5efeb0eb6a9a45287b5e4">BuildMI</a>(CaptureSpec, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/dwarf-linker/#a463a58e257d5f6fb2c39eb9a2474fc24ac2e06fc138163b7095fa483616a0a47a">DebugLoc</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>-&gt;get(X86::PAUSE));</span></CodeLine>
